title: Users and contacts
content:
There are two types of person records: users and contacts. Users can log in to Service Management; contacts can't. Users and contacts have the same fields, except that users also have license, role, and group membership information. A badge in the upper right corner of the page indicates whether a person is a user or contact.

You can import and delete users from Suite Administration; or, if the suite admin has enabled the "Manage users in tenant" feature, you as a tenant admin can also create users in Service Management manually. Service Management users must have a user record and an assigned role before they can log in to the application.

If you are a tenant admin, part of your responsibilities include managing user records, creating user groups, lists of contacts, and managing user roles. You can create contact records with information about internal or external users.

How to view users and contacts

The People page displays both users and contacts.

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > People.
  2. Select the required view:
    • To display active users only, click ACTIVE USERS.
    • To display active contacts only, click ACTIVE CONTACTS.
    • To display all users, click ALL USERS.
    • To display all contacts, click ALL CONTACTS.
    • To display all people, click ALL PEOPLE.

These views can't be deleted.

How to add, edit, or delete users in Suite Administration

If you are a Suite Administration user, you can add new users to Service Management by using Suite Administration. You can also edit and delete users. Users added, deleted, or modified in Suite Administration are updated in Service Management automatically by the synchronization job that runs every two hours.

To manage users in Suite Administration, follow these steps:

  1. Go to Suite Administration and log in with your credentials.
  2. Click Users.

  3. To add a new user, click New User and enter the user's details.

    When you add a new user, the following fields are synced:

    • Email
    • First name
    • Last name
    • Office phone number
  4. To edit a user, select the user in the list, edit the user's details and click Save.

  5. To delete a user, select the user in the list and click Delete on the toolbar.

    When you delete a user in Suite Administration, the user becomes a contact in Service Management. If the user was a member of any groups, he is removed from the groups and the following fields and sections are cleared:

    • Group membership section on the User page.
    • Organization field on the User page.
    • License and Role fields on the User page.
    • Request on behalf tab on the User page.

    • Group members section on the Group page.

    • Owner and Group owner backup fields on the Group page.

    • Delegations tab in the Service Portal.

    Once a user is deleted in Suite Administration, the user will become a contact in the tenant after two hours at most. Then, the related licenses can be re-assigned to other users three days later. Do not delete the contact within three days, or the license will not be released.

To synchronize the users manually, click in the People page in Service Management. Alternatively, a user added in Suite Administration is added to Service Management when attempting to log in for the first time, before a manual or automatic synchronization. The Sync button is disabled while any user on the tenant is running a sync.

You can also populate users to a tenant by using the Manage Persons API. For more information, see Manage Persons API.

For existing users, you can run a sync to update their data from an LDAP server using the LDAP integration. For more information, see How to set up synchronization with LDAP.

  • New users are assigned the Service Portal User role by default.
  • Any changes made to a user's details in Service Management are overwritten by the values in Suite Administration during the sync.

How to manage users in the tenant

If you are a tenant admin and the "Manage users in tenant" feature is enabled by the suite admin in Suite Administration, you can unlock users, trigger password reset emails, change the person type, and create users.

Unlock users

When a user enters an incorrect password over 5 times during login, the system locks the user. The tenant admin can unlock the user.

To unlock a user, follow these steps:

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > People.
  2. Click the user in the ID column to display the selected user.
  3. Click Unlock user on the toolbar to unlock the user as needed.

Alternatively, you can use the Unlock user business rule template in Studio or on the Task plan tab of a record to automatically unlock the desired users.

Reset password

To reset the password for a user, follow these steps as a tenant admin:

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > People.
  2. Click the user in the ID column to display the selected user.
  3. Click Reset password on the toolbar. The user would receive an email with instructions on resetting password.

You can only reset password for users with DB authentication type.

Alternatively, you can use the Reset password business rule template in Studio or on the Task plan tab of a record to automatically send the user an email with instructions on how to reset the password.

Change person type

To change the person type, follow these steps as a tenant admin:

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > People.
  2. Click the user in the ID column to display the selected person.
  3. Click Convert to user or Convert to contact on the toolbar based on the type of person you selected. When converting a contact to a user, make sure you specify the authentication type.
  4. Click OK.
    A message will appear at the top when the conversion succeeds.

For contact-to-user conversion, if the user with the same authentication type already exists in Suite Administration, the conversion will update this user record. The system won’t send an email notification to the user for password resetting. If such a user doesn’t exist in Suite Administration, the conversion will create a user with the specified authentication type. In this case, only DB users can receive email notifications for password resetting.

Alternatively, you can use the Convert contact to user or Convert user to contact business rule templates in Studio or on the Task plan tab of a record to automatically change the person type.

How to create and delete users or contacts

For more information, see How to create and delete users or contacts.

How to edit a user or contact record

You can edit a user's basic account information in Suite Administration. For more information, see the How to add, edit, or delete users section.

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > People.

  2. Select the user or contact you want to update.

    To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

  3. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.

    You can edit multiple records simultaneously by selecting them in the grid and updating them in the Preview pane on the right. For more information, see Mass update.

  4. Update the person's information in the General and Responsibilities tabs. For more information, see the User and contact details section.

  5. To open, join, or view a discussion or to view or post comments, click the Discussions tab. For more information, see Discussions.
  6. To view changes or updates made to the record, click the History tab. For more information, see History.

  7. Click   Save on the toolbar.

User and contact details

  • General tab

    The following sections are displayed:

    • General

      Field Description
      Prefix The prefix of the person. Select a value from the drop-down list.
      First name

      The first name of the person.

      The value of this field is automatically synchronized with the value in Suite Administration. When adding or editing people records, this field is mandatory. Semicolon (;), equal (=), angle brackets (<>), octothorpe (#), curly brackets ({}), pipe (|), back quote (`), caret (^), tilde (~), percent (%), question mark (?), quotation mark ("), slash (/), or square brackets ([]) can't be used in this field.
      Middle name The middle name of the person. Semicolon (;), equal (=), angle brackets (<>), octothorpe (#), curly brackets ({}), pipe (|), back quote (`), caret (^), tilde (~), percent (%), question mark (?), quotation mark ("), slash (/), or square brackets ([]) can't be used in this field.
      Last name

      The last name of the person. 

      The value of this field is automatically synchronized with the value in Suite Administration. When adding or editing people records, this field is mandatory. Semicolon (;), equal (=), angle brackets (<>), octothorpe (#), curly brackets ({}), pipe (|), back quote (`), caret (^), tilde (~), percent (%), question mark (?), quotation mark ("), slash (/), or square brackets ([]) can't be used in this field.
      Name

      The Name field is populated by the values entered in the First name and Last name fields when the person record is created. It can also be edited manually. Semicolon (;), equal (=), angle brackets (<>), octothorpe (#), curly brackets ({}), pipe (|), back quote (`), caret (^), tilde (~), percent (%), question mark (?), quotation mark ("), slash (/), or square brackets ([]) can't be used in this field.

      Changes made to the First name and Last name fields later aren't reflected in the Name field.
      Employee Id The person's employee ID number.
      Gender The gender of the person. Select a value from the drop-down list.
      Person type Indicates whether the person is a user or a contact. This field is read-only.
      VIP Indicates if the person has VIP status. This field can be used to indicate to agents that they are working on a VIP customer. It can also be used in business rules to boost priorities.
      Description Other information about the person.
      Person status

      The person's employment status. Select a value from the drop-down list.

      The available options are:

      • Active
      • Leave of absence
      • Retired
      • Terminated
      • Inactive
      This field doesn't control the user’s ability to log in to the Agent Interface or Service Portal. To restrict the user’s ability to log in, a suite administrator can change the user status from Active to Inactive or lock the user in Suite Administration. If Person Status is empty or null, notifications are not sent to that person. You can add a custom value (for example, External Consultant / Non-Employee) to the Person Status list and use that value instead of keeping the field empty to send notifications.
      User principal name

      The person's primary identifier in Service Management. This field is only editable during the creation of a new person. You can enter up to 64 characters. Spaces, tabs, semicolon (;), equal (=), ampersand (&), angle brackets (<>), octothorpe (#), curly brackets ({}), pipe (|), back quote (`), caret (^), tilde (~), percent (%), question mark (?), quotation mark ("), slash (/), square brackets ([]), or two consecutive underscores (_) can't be used in this field.

      When adding people records via Suite Administration, this field is populated with the login name value from Suite Administration. When adding or editing people records, this field is mandatory.
      Distinguished name The person's LDAP distinguished name.
      Authentication type

      The person's authentication type: DB or LDAP/SAML/OAUTH. This field is read-only.

      If you find this field has empty values for user records added before an upgrade, run a script to synchronize the authentication type information from Suite Administration.

    • Contact information

      Field Description
      Email

      The person's email address.

      The value of this field is automatically synchronized with the value in Suite Administration. When adding or editing people records, this field is mandatory.
      Office phone number

      The person's office phone number.

      The value of this field is automatically synchronized with the value in Suite Administration.
      Mobile phone number The person's mobile phone number.
      Home phone number The person's home phone number.
      Location

      Where the person is located. Select a value from the drop-down list.

      Examples:

      • France/Paris
      • EMEA/Spain/Madrid/M1

      To manage locations, see Locations.

      When you tap the location of a person in the mobile app with agent mode, the system will open the map app and search for the location.
      In such case, the system will search for the full street address as first priority. If the addresss doesn't exist, the system will search for the display name of the location.
      Home location The person's home address.
      Temporary location A temporary location for the person, for visiting purposes. Select a value from the drop-down list.

    • Organizational information

      Field Description
      Employment type

      The person's employment type. Select a value from the drop-down list.

      The available options are:

      • Full-time
      • Part-time
      • Contractor
      • Internal
      • External
      Title

      The person's title. The title can be job- or organization-related.

      Examples: Process Owner, Manager, Agent
      Manager The person's manager. Select a value from the drop-down list.
      Hire date The person's hire date. Click in the box to display a calendar.
      Leave date The person's leave date. Click in the box to display a calendar.
      Cost center The cost center at which the person is employed.
      Organization

      The organizational group of which the person is a member, if any. For functional group information, see the Group membership section for this person.

      • This field is only relevant for users.
      • A user can belong to one organizational group, and one or more functional groups. For more information about group types, see How to create a group.

    • Personal preferences

      Field Description
      Avatar The person's avatar. Click Upload image to select an image for the avatar.
      Language

      The language of the person's locale. Select a value from the drop-down list.

      The default value is English (U.S.). To set the default language for new users to a different value, edit the relevant business rule.
      Home Page

      The person's home page. 

      Note that this field displays a full list of pages, including those that the current person has no permission to access. 
      Default Dashboard

      The person's default dashboard displayed on My Dashboards > Dashboard. 

      Note that this field displays only those dashboard definitions that the current person has permission to access. 

    • System use definitions

      The System use definitions section is only relevant for users.

      Field Description
      Role

      The roles assigned to the user, if any. Click in the box to display a list of available roles.

      A user can have more than one role.
      License

      Select the licenses assigned to the user, if any. Click in the box to display a list of available licenses. For each license, the license type (Premium Named, Express Named, Premium Concurrent, or Express Concurrent for use with the MT console) and the license capacity are displayed.

      • A user can have more than one license.

      • An admin user can assign licenses to users. For each license, a yellow icon is displayed at the top of the people admin page indicating the number of users that have an assigned license. The caption next to the icon indicates the number of users that have been assigned with a license (automatically when users successfully log in the first time or by manually assigned license) and the total license capacity of the tenant. For example, 25/100 users indicate that 25 users are assigned the license, out of a total of 100 possible users.
      • When the tenant only has named licenses, you must assign a named license to the user with a Service Management user role. Otherwise, the user is unable to access Service Management and Service Portal.
      May generate passcode verification code

      If selected, the user has permission to generate verification codes for passcodes for other users for strong identity validation for approvals.
      Verification code email recipient

      If selected, the user receives an email when any user requests a verification code for the user's passcode to proceed with a task approval using strong identity validation.

    • Group membership

      The Group membership section is only relevant for users.

      Field Description
      <Add/Remove groups>

      The functional groups to which the user belongs, if any. To add a group, click Assign to group and select the required group(s) in the Add groups dialog box. To delete a group, select the required group and click the Delete button.

      • A user can belong to one organizational group, and one or more functional groups.

        For more information about group types, see How to create a group.

      • After this field is updated, it may take several minutes before the user can see information entitled to him by the groups to which he belongs. For more information, see How to manage entitlement rules.
      • When more than 250 groups are assigned to a user, although all groups are successfully assigned, only the 250 groups are displayed in the user's details.  

  • Responsibilities tab

    The following sections are displayed:

    • Responsibilities

      Field Description
      Area of practice The person's area of practice on the system. Select a value from the drop-down list.

    • Locations

      Field Description
      <Add/Remove locations>

      The person's locations of responsibility.

      To add a location, do one of the following:

      • Click Add, then select a value from the drop-down list.
      • Click the list icon (   ) to display the available locations. Select the check box for each location that you want to add. Click OK.

      To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

      The selected locations appear in yellow. When you save the person, the locations are added.

      To remove a location, select the location and click Remove. The selected members appear in strikethrough text. When you save the person, the locations are removed.

    • Area of expertise

      Field Description
      Skills The person's area of expertise on the system. Add your expertise skills in the field.

  • Request on behalf tab

    The following sections are displayed:

    • Users

      Field Description
      <Add/Remove users>

      The person can create a request on behalf of the users defined here.

      To add a user, do one of the following:

      • Click Add, then select a user to add.
      • Click the list icon (   ) to display the available users. Select the check box for each user that you want to add. Click OK.

      To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

      The selected users appear in yellow. When you save the person, the users are added.

      To remove a user, select the user and click Remove. The selected users appear in strikethrough text. When you save the person, the users are removed.

    • Group members

      Field Description
      <Add/Remove groups>

      The person can create a request on behalf of the members of the groups defined here.

      To add a group, do one of the following:

      • Click Add, then select a group to add.
      • Click the list icon (   ) to display the available groups. Select the check box for each group that you want to add. Click OK.

      To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

      The selected groups appear in yellow. When you save the person, the groups are added.

      To remove a group, select the group and click Remove. The selected groups appear in strikethrough text. When you save the person, the groups are removed.

    For more information on requesting on behalf of users and group members, see Request on behalf.

  • Discussions tab

    For more information, see Discussions.

  • History tab

    For more information, see History.

Enable non-tenant admins to manage user lifecycle

Non-tenant admins can manage the entire user lifecycle in Service Management (excluding using the Sync functionality and running the Manage Person API), and changes will be automatically synchronized to Suite Administration. To achieve this, the tenant admin needs to create a role with certain permissions and assign this role to the required user. For more information about creating a role and granting permissions, see Roles and Assign permissions to a role for Administration modules.

To support non-tenant admins managing user lifecycle, the tenant admin must select Visible for the People module in the Administration menu visibility section in Administration > Master Data > People > Roles.

This table describes the extra permissions required for non-tenant admins to perform various user operations. Locate the Record types and Resources sections on the Roles page to add permissions.

Operation Action Required permission Note
Create Create a contact

Create permission for the Person record type

 -
Create a user

Create permission for the Person record type;

Create permission for the Authorization Principal Resource resource and View permission for the Role Resource resource

 If permissions to Authorization Principal Resource and Role Resource are not granted, the Create user field won't be visible when you create a new user.
Update Edit user or contact information

Update permission for the Person record type;

View permission for the Authorization Principal Resource resource and View permission for the Role Resource resource

Updates to the following fields in Service Management will be automatically synchronized to Suite Administration:

Email/First name/Middle name/Last name/Language/Office phone number/Home phone number/Mobile phone number
Unlock a user Update permission for the Person record type -
Reset password Update permission for the Person record type -
Convert to user

Update permission for the Person record type;

Create permissions for the Authorization Principal Resource resource and View permission for the Role Resource resource

 -
Convert to contact

Update permission for the Person record type

 -
Delete Delete a user or contact Delete permission for the Person record type -

Best practices

To simplify configurations, here are some best practices for setting up a non-tenant admin to manage the user lifecycle.

For complete user lifecycle management, assign these permissions:

  • Create, Update, and Delete permissions for the Person record type
  • Create, View, and Update permissions for the Authorization Principal Resource resource and View permission for the Role Resource resource

For limited user lifecycle management, for example, if the tenant admin only needs to manage user information and you prefer not to assign roles to the non-tenant admin, grant the following permissions and add the user to a specific group that provides the necessary access:

  • Create, Update, and Delete permissions for the Person record type
  • View and Update permissions for the Authorization Principal Resource resource and View permission for the Role Resource resource
